label: Weapon_Sword_002_PictureBook
text: A sword brandished by the soldiers who once protected Hyrule Castle. Its durable blade is well tuned for slaying monsters.

label: Weapon_Sword_019_PictureBook
text: A skeletal arm that keeps moving even after it’s severed from its body. It's kind of gross to strap it to your back, but it'll do in a pinch. It's old and fragile, so it's quick to break.

label: Weapon_Sword_027_PictureBook
text: The ornamentation that adorns this blade is a traditional Zora design. It's forged from a very durable and rust-proof metal.

label: Weapon_Sword_029_Name
text: Gerudo Scimitar

label: Weapon_Sword_009_PictureBook
text: More blades means more attack power! It can be used as a boomerang, but all those blades makes that a bit more dangerous. Carried by Black Lizalfos seasoned in battle.

label: Weapon_Sword_018_PictureBook
text: A brutal sword carried by white-haired Lynels. The savage blades are strong enough to cut down any foe, no matter how strong.

label: Weapon_Sword_052_Desc
text: A famous sword once beloved by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. It is said that when Urbosa swung this sword in battle, her movements resembled a beautiful dance.

label: Weapon_Sword_502_PictureBook
text: A weapon that defeats foes with one hit and causes the user to die from one hit. It loses its sheen and power after two consecutive uses, but will eventually regain both.

label: Weapon_Sword_001_Name
text: Traveler's Sword

label: Weapon_Sword_053_Desc
text: A grim weapon favored by the Yiga. The half- moon shape of the blade allows for the rapid delivery of fatal wounds and serves as a symbol of their terror. Its durability is low.

label: Weapon_Sword_002_Name
text: Soldier's Broadsword

label: Weapon_Sword_003_Name
text: Knight's Broadsword

label: Weapon_Sword_057_Desc
text: A sword said to have once belonged to a hero from the sky. Its blade houses the fire of the Goddess. When wielded, a strange yet heavenly breeze kicks up around you.

label: Weapon_Sword_058_Desc
text: A sword once wielded by a hero in an ancient age. When grasped, a strange sense of nostalgia washes over you. Take it when going alone would otherwise be dangerous.

label: Weapon_Sword_057_Name
text: Goddess Sword

label: Weapon_Sword_059_Desc
text: A boomerang said to have been used by a hero who traveled the Great Sea. It smells faintly of salt water.

label: Weapon_Sword_030_Desc
text: Delicate Gerudo carvings decorate this curved sword. The engraved blade is extremely sharp. Apparently it once served ceremonial purposes in festivals.

label: Weapon_Sword_058_Name
text: Sword

label: Weapon_Sword_031_Desc
text: Rito craftsmen forged this lightweight, double-edged sword so Rito warriors could soar into battle unhindered by its weight.

label: Weapon_Sword_059_Name
text: Sea-Breeze Boomerang

label: Weapon_Sword_030_Name
text: Moonlight Scimitar

label: Weapon_Sword_070_Name
text: Master Sword

label: Weapon_Sword_031_Name
text: Feathered Edge

label: Weapon_Sword_033_Desc
text: This magical sword was forged in the lava of Death Mountain. It leaves white-hot flames in its wake when the blade glows red.

label: Weapon_Sword_034_Desc
text: A magical sword forged in the frigid mountains of the Hebra region. When the blade glows blue, enemies struck by it will become frozen.

label: Weapon_Sword_033_Name
text: Flameblade

label: Weapon_Sword_035_Desc
text: A magical sword forged and refined by lightning from the Hyrule Hills. When the blade shines with a golden light, it will electrocute enemies struck by it.

label: Weapon_Sword_034_Name
text: Frostblade

label: Weapon_Sword_035_Name
text: Thunderblade

label: Weapon_Sword_060_Desc
text: A magical rod that can cast fireballs, crafted by an ancient magician. The rod will break if it strikes something directly, so use it wisely.

label: Weapon_Sword_061_Desc
text: A magical rod crafted from refined ice found in the Hebra Mountains. This rod can cast waves of freezing air. Great for magic—not so great for melee.

label: Weapon_Sword_062_Desc
text: A magical rod that can shoot balls of electricity. Its gem contains lightning from the Hyrule Hills. It's not recommended to use as a melee weapon.

label: Weapon_Sword_062_PictureBook
text: A magical rod that can shoot balls of electricity. Its gem contains lightning from the Hyrule Hills. It's not recommended to use as a melee weapon.

label: Weapon_Sword_053_PictureBook
text: A grim weapon favored by the Yiga. The half- moon shape of the blade allows for the rapid delivery of fatal wounds and serves as a symbol of their terror. Its durability is low.

label: Weapon_Sword_070_PictureBook
text: The legendary sword that seals the darkness. Its blade gleams with a sacred luster that can oppose the Calamity. Only a hero chosen by the sword itself may wield it.

label: Weapon_Sword_043_PictureBook
text: This torch will stay lit once ignited, but if you put it away, the flame will be extinguished until you light it again.

label: Weapon_Sword_052_PictureBook
text: A famous sword once beloved by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. It is said that when Urbosa swung this sword in battle, her movements resembled a beautiful dance.

label: Weapon_Sword_034_PictureBook
text: A magical sword forged in the frigid mountains of the Hebra region. When the blade glows blue, enemies struck by it will become frozen.

label: Weapon_Sword_061_PictureBook
text: A magical rod crafted from refined ice found in the Hebra Mountains. This rod can cast waves of freezing air. Great for magic—not so great for melee.

label: Weapon_Sword_024_PictureBook
text: The Hyrulean royal family would award this sword to knights who achieved remarkable feats. A sword that balances strength and beauty as elegantly as this one is a rare find.

label: Weapon_Sword_033_PictureBook
text: This magical sword was forged in the lava of Death Mountain. It leaves white-hot flames in its wake when the blade glows red.

label: Weapon_Sword_015_PictureBook
text: The abilities of this Guardian sword have been boosted to the maximum, as evidenced by its increase in size. It slices through armor like a hot knife through butter!

label: Weapon_Sword_023_PictureBook
text: The blade of this sword was made using an ancient power lost to this modern age. Its blade appears only when drawn, and its cutting power surpasses metal swords.

label: Weapon_Sword_005_PictureBook
text: A reinforced Bokoblin club made to maximize damage. The sharpened bones jabbed into it make it a brutal weapon.

label: Weapon_Sword_014_PictureBook
text: This Guardian sword has enhanced power over the standard model. Its cutting capabilities are improved, and its durability has seen a slight uptick.

label: Weapon_Sword_049_PictureBook
text: A magical rod that can cast extreme cold in a wide range. These are crafted from refined ice found at the summit of Hebra Peak. It will break when depleted.

label: Weapon_Sword_004_PictureBook
text: A crude Bokoblin club made to clobber small prey. It's essentially a stick, so its durability is low.

label: Weapon_Sword_048_PictureBook
text: A magical rod that can cast three fireballs at once, crafted by an ancient magician. It will break upon running out of magical energy, so make it last!

label: Weapon_Sword_029_Desc
text: This common sword is often carried by Gerudo women for self-defense. Its short, curved blade is easily recognized.

label: Weapon_Sword_040_Desc
text: This strange hammer is one of Kilton's specialties. Being struck by it doesn't hurt much, but the fourth swing in a string of attacks will send the victim flying.

label: Weapon_Sword_001_Desc
text: A very common sword often kept by travelers to fend off small beasts. It's fairly durable but a bit unreliable against monsters.

label: Weapon_Sword_002_Desc
text: A sword brandished by the soldiers who once protected Hyrule Castle. Its durable blade is well tuned for slaying monsters.

label: Weapon_Sword_041_Desc
text: A single-edged sword traditional to the Sheikah tribe. Forged using ancient technology, it just may be among the sharpest conventional weapons ever made.

label: Weapon_Sword_040_Name
text: Spring-Loaded Hammer

label: Weapon_Sword_003_Desc
text: Knights of Hyrule once carried this sword. These days it's the weapon of choice for seasoned adventurers thanks to its ease of use and high attack power.

label: Weapon_Sword_043_Desc
text: This torch will stay lit once ignited, but if you put it away, the flame will be extinguished until you light it again.

label: Weapon_Sword_041_Name
text: Eightfold Blade

label: Weapon_Sword_004_Desc
text: A crude Bokoblin club made to clobber small prey. It's essentially a stick, so its durability is low.

label: Weapon_Sword_005_Desc
text: A reinforced Bokoblin club made to maximize damage. The sharpened bones jabbed into it make it a brutal weapon.

label: Weapon_Sword_502_Name
text: One-Hit Obliterator

label: Weapon_Sword_043_Name
text: Torch

label: Weapon_Sword_004_Name
text: Boko Club

label: Weapon_Sword_006_Desc
text: This Bokoblin club has been reinforced with fossilized bones to maximize clobbering potential. Only the brawniest of Bokoblins can manage its immense weight.

label: Weapon_Sword_044_Name
text: Tree Branch

label: Weapon_Sword_005_Name
text: Spiked Boko Club

label: Weapon_Sword_007_Desc
text: A curved sword favored by the Lizalfos. It can be used to attack directly or can be thrown like a boomerang.

label: Weapon_Sword_006_Name
text: Dragonbone Boko Club

label: Weapon_Sword_008_Desc
text: Blue Lizalfos in particular like this weapon. It has one more blade than the Lizal boomerang to give it additional cutting power, and it still returns when thrown.

label: Weapon_Sword_007_Name
text: Lizal Boomerang

label: Weapon_Sword_009_Desc
text: More blades means more attack power! It can be used as a boomerang, but all those blades makes that a bit more dangerous. Carried by Black Lizalfos seasoned in battle.

label: Weapon_Sword_008_Name
text: Lizal Forked Boomerang

label: Weapon_Sword_070_Desc
text: The legendary sword that seals the darkness. Its blade gleams with a sacred luster that can oppose the Calamity. Only a hero chosen by the sword itself may wield it.

label: Weapon_Sword_009_Name
text: Lizal Tri-Boomerang

label: Weapon_Sword_073_Desc
text: This lethal weapon is forged by the Yiga. Its unique shape facilitates the sound dispatching of any target and strikes fear into the hearts of all who see it.

label: Weapon_Sword_073_Name
text: Demon Carver

label: Weapon_Sword_030_PictureBook
text: Delicate Gerudo carvings decorate this curved sword. The engraved blade is extremely sharp. Apparently it once served ceremonial purposes in festivals.

label: Weapon_Sword_050_Desc
text: A magical rod that can hurl three balls of electricity at once. Its gem contains electricity from the Hyrule Hills, and the rod will break when that electricity runs out.

label: Weapon_Sword_073_PictureBook
text: This lethal weapon is forged by the Yiga. Its unique shape facilitates the sound dispatching of any target and strikes fear into the hearts of all who see it.

label: Weapon_Sword_020_PictureBook
text: The arm of a Stalizalfos that continues to struggle even in death. It can be used as a weapon, but it's very brittle. You can feel it wiggling when you strap it to your back...
